thread.title: More Indiana electronic highway signs to show travel times
thread.title_full: More Indiana electronic highway signs to show travel times

author: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
title: More Indiana electronic highway signs to show travel times
text:
Indiana highway agency adds estimated travel times to 7 electronic boards along interstates 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/2/15 6:16 am EDT - Updated: 7/2/15 6:19 am EDT 
INDIANAPOLIS â€” The state highway department has added estimated travel times to seven electronic message boards along Indiana interstates ahead of the Fourth of July weekend. 
Agency officials say those displays of distances and travel times to upcoming locations will help drivers decide which routes they should take. 
Four of the new signs are along I-70 or I-65 near Indianapolis, one each along I-80/94 and I-65 in northwestern Indiana's Lake County and one on I-65 in Clarksville, just north of Louisville, Kentucky. They will display travel times when not showing messages about crashes or road conditions. 
The new boards will supplement 26 dedicated travel-time signs in Indiana's larger metropolitan areas.
